intro: Sphaeralcea mendocina, commonly known as the Mendocino globemallow, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy, ribbed stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Sphaeralcea mendocina is an important plant for local pollinators and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
